trustfund:
TF021459-CAETF - HONDURAS' IBRD/IDA
            DEBT SERVICE,TF021461-CAETF - HONDURAS' EXTERNAL
            DEBT SERVICE (NON IBRD/IDA)

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Hurricane Emergency
            Project in Honduras is deemed satisfactory with likely
            sustainability, negligible developmental impact, and
            satisfactory performances by both the Bank and the borrower.
            The project was part of a larger package of assistance to
            Honduras in response to the ravages of Hurricane Mitch. The
            major factors affecting project implementation were the good
            financial and project management. Early Bank involvement,
            with a quick assessment of a country's macroeconomic
            situation, is needed to develop an effective emergency
            assistance project. Longer term concerns about disaster
            management preparedness and mitigation need to be address,
            but it is not effective to combine this with emergency
            support objectives. The existence of experienced operational
            staff in the Field office is fundamental.
